## 판결문 요약


467 S.E.2d 203 (1996)
219 Ga. App. 878
GREEN
v.
The STATE.
No. A95A2241.
Court of Appeals of Georgia.
January 19, 1996.
*204 Willie T. Yancey, Jr., Savannah, for appellant.
Spencer Lawton, Jr., District Attorney, and Lori E. Tepper, Assistant District Attorney, for appellee.
BEASLEY, Chief Judge.
Green was convicted of armed robbery (OCGA § 16-8-41) and possession of a firearm during the commission of a crime (OCGA § 16-11-106). Green's motion for a new trial was denied and he appeals.
We view the evidence in a light most favorable to the verdict. Pardo v. State, 215 Ga.App. 317(1), 450 S.E.2d 440 (1994). Green went to the Southern Motors car dealership in Savannah and expressed interest in a 1991 Honda Accord. Bremer, a sales associate, spoke to Green a few moments until sales associate Silverstein could actually assist Green. At Green's request, Silverstein agreed to accompany him for a test drive, even though the dealership was to close in 20 minutes. It was still daylight. The two struck up a conversation during the drive, primarily focused on their military service in the Persian Gulf conflict. Silverstein became *205 suspicious when Green was evasive in answering certain questions about his family and experiences in the military. He began to look for distinguishing marks on Green and noticed a prominent footprint-shaped scar or birthmark on Green's arm.
Green drove the car into an apartment complex, indicating to Silverstein that he wanted to show the car to a friend. ...
